body:
The cluster was created yesterday with 635cf5877f9e52292d8d4930fd3c9c9aae6efeaa

I ran some tests (creating 100 pods per node, monitoring, and deleting the pod) in my cluster overnight. This morning I checked the node status and found numerous node status update failures in `var/log/kubelet.log`:

```
ubelet.go:2589] Error updating node status, will retry: nodes "e2e-test-yjhong-minion-49kb" cannot be updated: the object has been modified; please apply your changes to the latest version and try again

The `/var/log/kube-apiserver.log` shows only kubelet is updating the node/status object.

I0203 17:21:59.144952       5 handlers.go:130] PUT /api/v1/nodes/e2e-test-yjhong-minion-49kb/status: (1.707016ms) 409 [[kubelet/v1.2.0 (linux/amd64) kubernetes/bb78b6d] 10.240.0.3:54357]
```

The node status update frequency is 10s. From `kubelet.log`, it seems like that kubelet's trying to update the node status every second (including the retries). I am not sure how this happened and whether this can be reproduced reliably.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Node.
labels.name: sig/node

title: Stressed kubelet may start multiple goroutines for tasks (kubelet.Run())
